page.title: 14LANDSCAPE. OUT AND ABOUT
page.content: My name is Thomas Stone and I live in the North West corner of Bournemouth. My friend Mary Lucas lives across the road from me, in Poole. One fine sunny day we decided to go for a trek around the area. We headed for Turbary Common, about ten minutes walk away. On the way we passed our two schools, Oakmead Girls and Oakmead Boys. In September 1985 they are to be combined into one co-ed school. We also passed a fast growing industrial area called Roundways containing, at the moment, about thirty units. We then proceeded across the Common to the Wallisdown Road. This is the main road into Bournemouth from the South West. It is also part of the border between Bournemouth and Poole. Having crossed this busy road we very soon find ourselves in a green belt again.
